intro: Isochilus oaxacanus, commonly known as the Oaxacan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico, specifically the state of Oaxaca. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
